alert.note: Alert for Christian; Todd; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 1:38AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Kentucky, including the following counties, Christian, Todd and Trigg. * WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in location. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - The southern portions of the advisory area, including locations along and south of a line from Elkton to Hopkinsville to Cadiz, are most likely to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hopkinsville, Oak Grove, Cadiz, Elkton, Fort Campbell, Wranglers Campground, Golden Pond Visitors Center, Land Between The Lakes Area, Turkey Bay, Clarksville, Guthrie, Pembroke, Canton, Trenton, Lafayette, Herndon, Allegre, Clifty, Linton and Allensville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
